label: Behavior 95845199
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route (the combination of stable speed, small heading variations, and slowly changing COG indicates the vessel is navigating along a gently curving channel or coastal path; the trajectory approximates a circular arc with radius ~2.5 km, modeled by a parametric equation:
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a nearly constant speed between 16.2 and 16.7 knots across the trajectory)
Course change: gradual and consistent (COG shifts from ~115° to ~90°, then stabilizes around 88°–91°, indicating a smooth, continuous turn followed by straight-line travel)
Heading fluctuation: stable (heading remains tightly constrained between 89° and 91° after initial phase, with only minor variations during course adjustment)

Behavior intent: following a curved maritime route (the combination of stable speed, small heading variations, and slowly changing COG indicates the vessel is navigating along a gently curving channel or coastal path; the trajectory approximates a circular arc with radius ~2.5 km, modeled by a parametric equation:
